title: Food City Stores in Tennessee to Become Hub for Advanced Plastics Recycling - Progressive Grocer
summary: Food City partners with Eastman to introduce plastic-recycling options in the Appalachian Highlands region, enabling customers to recycle plastic waste for molecular recycling and creating new high-performance plastics.
green_innovation: TRUE - This initiative promotes the circular economy, reduces environmental impact, and utilizes molecular recycling technology for sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE - The partnership between Food City and Eastman introduces a new recycling service, differing significantly from their previous practices.
green_product: TRUE - The plastic recycling service offered by Food City and Eastman aligns with the definition of a green product with its focus on reducing environmental impact and promoting recycling.
green_process: TRUE - The molecular recycling process used by Eastman for creating new plastics from recycled materials is an example of a green process that minimizes environmental impact.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 445110 - Supermarkets and Other Grocery (except Convenience) Stores, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 325211 - Plastics Material and Resins Manufacturing, 562998 - All Other Waste Management Services
greenwashing: FALSE - The initiative appears to genuinely focus on plastic recycling and promoting sustainability goals without any signs of greenwashing.

title: What should be done with the millions of used tyres? - Polytechnique Insights

title: How Holcim is reducing cement's climate impact - Fortune
summary: The article discusses Switzerland's Renovate Switzerland movement demanding energy-efficient renovations of homes by 2030 to reduce CO2 emissions, with Holcim, a cement company, developing low-emissions concrete to combat climate change.
green_innovation: TRUE, as the article discusses the development of low-emissions concrete to reduce CO2 emissions, contributing to environmental sustainability by promoting energy-efficient buildings.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the article talks about Holcim's innovation in developing low-emissions cement and concrete for sustainable construction, which differs significantly from traditional cement products, demonstrating business innovation.
green_product: TRUE, as the article describes Holcim's eco-friendly cement and concrete products with reduced CO2 footprints, designed to support energy-efficient buildings, fulfill sustainable construction goals, and reduce environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE, as the article mentions Holcim's adoption of green processes like recycling construction waste into new cement and concrete products, minimizing waste and promoting sustainability in manufacturing.
product_or_process: Holcim's low-emissions cement and concrete products
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 327310 - Cement Manufacturing, 327999 - All Other Nonmetallic Mineral Product Manufacturing, 551114 - Corporate, Subsidiary, and Regional Managing Offices, 541330 - Engineering Services
greenwashing: FALSE, as the article details Holcim's genuine efforts to develop sustainable cement and concrete products, aiming to reduce emissions and promote eco-friendly construction practices.
